<!-- Autogenerated from JSR docs. Do not edit directly. -->

> ⚠️ **Unstable**: This @std package is experimental and its API may change without a major version bump.

## Overview

<p>Parses and loads environment variables from a <code>.env</code> file into the current
process, or stringify data into a <code>.env</code> file format.</p>
<p>Note: The key needs to match the pattern /^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$/.</p>
<pre class="highlight"><code><span class="pl-c">// Automatically load environment variables from a `.env` file</span>
<span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s">"@std/dotenv/load"</span>;

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class="pl-k">import</span> { parse, stringify } <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">"@std/dotenv"</span>;
<span class="pl-k">import</span> { assertEquals } <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">"@std/assert"</span>;

<span class="pl-en">assertEquals</span>(<span class="pl-en">parse</span>(<span class="pl-s">"GREETING=hello world"</span>), { <span class="pl-c1">GREETING</span>: <span class="pl-s">"hello world"</span> });
<span class="pl-en">assertEquals</span>(<span class="pl-en">stringify</span>({ <span class="pl-c1">GREETING</span>: <span class="pl-s">"hello world"</span> }), <span class="pl-s">"GREETING='hello world'"</span>);
</code><button class="copyButton" data-copy="import { parse, stringify } from &quot;@std/dotenv&quot;;
import { assertEquals } from &quot;@std/assert&quot;;

assertEquals(parse(&quot;GREETING=hello world&quot;), { GREETING: &quot;hello world&quot; });
assertEquals(stringify({ GREETING: &quot;hello world&quot; }), &quot;GREETING='hello world'&quot;);
